problem_text: A car covers 150 km in 3 hours. What is its speed?
The sum of two numbers is 40 and their difference is 10. Find the numbers.
If a book costs $12 and you buy 5 books, how much do you spend?
A rectangle has a length of 10 cm and width of 6 cm. What is its area?
If 40% of a number is 80, what is the number?
solution_text: Let x be the number: 0.4x = 80 → x = 200

problem_text: A train travels at 60 km/h. How far does it travel in 2.5 hours?
The perimeter of a square is 36 cm. What is the length of each side?
If 3 pens cost $6, how much do 8 pens cost?
The sum of three consecutive numbers is 51. Find the numbers.
solution_text: Let x, x+1, x+2 be the numbers: x + (x+1) + (x+2) = 51 → x = 16. Numbers are 16, 17, 18

problem_text: A store offers a 25% discount on a $80 item. What is the sale price?
If the ratio of boys to girls is 3:2 and there are 15 boys, how many girls are there?
A circle has a radius of 5 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
If a worker earns $15 per hour and works 40 hours a week, what is the weekly earnings?
The area of a triangle is 30 cm² and its base is 10 cm. What is the height?
If you have $500 and spend 30% of it, how much is left?
A recipe requires 2 cups of flour for 24 cookies. How much flour is needed for 36 cookies?
If the average of 4 numbers is 25, what is their sum?
A tank holds 500 liters and is 60% full. How many liters are in the tank?
If x + 5 = 20, what is the value of x?
The cost of 6 notebooks is $18. What is the cost of 10 notebooks?
If a car depreciates by 15% each year and costs $20,000 now, what will it cost after 1 year?
The sum of angles in a triangle is 180°. If two angles are 50° and 70°, what is the third angle?
If you invest $1,000 at 5% annual interest, how much interest will you earn in 1 year?
A photo is 8 inches by 6 inches. If you enlarge it by a scale factor of 1.5, what are the new dimensions?
solution_text: New length = 8 × 1.5 = 12 inches, New width = 6 × 1.5 = 9 inches

problem_text: If the population of a city increases by 20% and was 100,000, what is the new population?
A student scored 85, 90, and 88 on three tests. What is the average score?
If a recipe serves 4 people and uses 2 eggs, how many eggs are needed to serve 10 people?
The distance between two cities is 300 km. If a car travels at 75 km/h, how long does it take?
If the probability of an event is 0.25, what is the probability it does not occur?
A store buys items for $50 and sells them for $80. What is the profit margin percentage?
If 15% of a number is 45, what is 30% of that number?
A rectangular garden is 20 meters long and 15 meters wide. What is its perimeter?
If a subscription costs $10 per month, how much does it cost for 2 years?
The area of a square is 64 cm². What is its perimeter?
If you save $50 per week, how much will you save in 1 year?
A ball is dropped from 100 meters. If it bounces to 80% of its previous height, how high is the first bounce?
If the tax rate is 8% and an item costs $50, what is the total cost including tax?
A class has 30 students. If 20% are absent, how many are present?
If 2x + 3 = 13, what is the value of x?
The ratio of apples to oranges in a basket is 5:3. If there are 15 apples, how many oranges are there?
A book is on sale for 35% off. If the original price is $40, what is the sale price?
The volume of a rectangular prism is 120 cm³. If the length is 10 cm and width is 4 cm, what is the height?
solution_text: Volume = length × width × height → 120 = 10 × 4 × h → h = 3 cm

problem_text: If a bicycle costs $300 and you pay $75 upfront, how much is left to pay?
The temperature increased by 8°C to reach 25°C. What was the original temperature?
If 60% of students pass a test and there are 150 students, how many fail?
A runner completes 5 km in 25 minutes. What is their speed in km/h?
If a movie ticket costs $12 and you buy one for yourself and two for friends, how much do you spend?
A cube has sides of 5 cm. What is its volume?
If the ratio of cats to dogs is 4:7 and there are 28 dogs, how many cats are there?
A number is increased by 25% to become 100. What was the original number?
If you divide 144 by 12, what is the quotient?
A store offers buy-one-get-one-free on items priced at $20. If you take advantage of this offer twice, how much do you spend?
solution_text: Cost = 2 × 20 = $40 (you get 4 items but pay for 2)

problem_text: The perimeter of a rectangle is 50 cm. If the length is 15 cm, what is the width?
If a phone costs $600 and you get a 12% discount, how much do you pay?
A bucket contains 20 liters of water. If 25% leaks out, how much water remains?
If you read 30 pages of a 300-page book, what percentage have you read?
A parking lot charges $5 for the first hour and $2 for each additional hour. If you park for 4 hours, how much do you pay?
If the mean of 5 numbers is 20, and 4 of them are 15, 20, 25, 30, what is the fifth number?
A plant grows 2 cm per week. How tall will it be after 10 weeks if it started at 5 cm?
If the area of a circle is 78.5 cm² (π ≈ 3.14), what is its radius?
A company gives a 10% bonus on salaries. If an employee earns $50,000, what is the new salary?
If a triangle has sides 3, 4, and 5, is it a right triangle? (Use Pythagorean theorem)
solution_text: 3² + 4² = 9 + 16 = 25 = 5² → Yes, it is a right triangle

problem_text: A recipe calls for 1.5 cups of sugar. If you want to make half the recipe, how much sugar do you need?
If the population doubles every 10 years and is currently 1,000, what will it be in 30 years?
solution_text: After 10 years: 2,000 → After 20 years: 4,000 → After 30 years: 8,000

problem_text: A student needs 70% to pass. If the test has 50 questions and each is worth 2 points, what is the passing score?
If a house is valued at $250,000 and increases by 5% per year, what will it be worth after 1 year?
A factory produces 500 items per day. How many items are produced in 30 days?
If you mix 3 cups of juice with 2 cups of water, what is the ratio of juice to total liquid?
A loan of $5,000 has a 6% annual interest rate. How much interest will you pay in 1 year?
If the slope of a line is 2 and it passes through (0, 3), what is the y-intercept?
solution_text: y-intercept = 3 (the b in y = mx + b)

problem_text: A bag contains 5 red balls and 3 blue balls. What is the probability of drawing a red ball?
If a job pays $25/hour and you work 8 hours a day, what do you earn in 5 days?
The sum of a number and its reciprocal is 5. If the number is positive, what is it?
solution_text: Let x be the number: x + 1/x = 5 → x² - 5x + 1 = 0 → x = (5 + √21)/2 ≈ 4.79

problem_text: If a chord is 12 cm long and the radius is 10 cm, how far is the chord from the center?
solution_text: Using Pythagorean theorem: d² + 6² = 10² → d² = 64 → d = 8 cm

problem_text: A person saves 15% of their income. If they earn $3,000 per month, how much do they save?
If the exterior angle of a regular polygon is 30°, how many sides does it have?
A train leaves at 8 AM and travels at 60 km/h. A car leaves at 10 AM and travels at 80 km/h. When will the car catch up?
solution_text: Train head start = 60 × 2 = 120 km → Time for car to catch up = 120 / (80 - 60) = 6 hours → 4 PM

problem_text: If the product of two numbers is 24 and their sum is 10, what are the numbers?
solution_text: Let x and y be numbers: xy = 24, x + y = 10 → x² - 10x + 24 = 0 → x = 6, y = 4

problem_text: A painting is 60 cm by 80 cm. If you frame it with a 5 cm border, what are the outer dimensions?
solution_text: Outer length = 60 + 2(5) = 70 cm, Outer width = 80 + 2(5) = 90 cm

problem_text: If a quiz has 20 questions and you answer 18 correctly, what is your percentage score?
A ball's bounce height decreases by 20% each time. If it starts at 200 cm, what is the height of the 3rd bounce?
solution_text: 1st bounce: 200 × 0.8 = 160 cm → 2nd bounce: 160 × 0.8 = 128 cm → 3rd bounce: 128 × 0.8 = 102.4 cm

problem_text: If the least common multiple of two numbers is 60 and the greatest common divisor is 5, and one number is 15, what is the other?
A cylindrical tank has a radius of 3 m and height of 10 m. What is its volume? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
If you buy an item for $100 and sell it for $150, what is the profit percentage?
A class has a boy-to-girl ratio of 2:3. If there are 10 boys, how many girls are there?
If the median of 5 numbers is 30 and the numbers are 10, 20, x, 40, 50, what is x?
solution_text: When ordered: 10, 20, x, 40, 50 → Median is the middle value = x = 30

problem_text: A rope is cut into 3 pieces in the ratio 2:3:4. If the total length is 36 m, what is the longest piece?
If a car uses 1 liter of fuel per 10 km and fuel costs $1.50 per liter, what is the cost per km?
The angles of a quadrilateral are in the ratio 1:2:3:4. What is the largest angle?
If the probability of rain is 40%, what is the probability it will not rain?
A store marks up items by 60% from cost. If an item costs $25 to make, what is the selling price?
If the diagonal of a square is 10 cm, what is the area of the square?
solution_text: Diagonal = side√2 → 10 = side√2 → side = 10/√2 ≈ 7.07 cm → Area = 50 cm²

problem_text: A farmer has 120 acres. If 30% is planted with corn, 25% with wheat, and the rest with soybeans, how many acres have soybeans?
If you invest $2,000 at 4% simple interest for 3 years, how much will you have?
A recipe uses butter and sugar in the ratio 1:2. If you use 150g of butter, how much sugar is needed?
If the temperature is -5°C and rises by 12°C, what is the new temperature?
A ladder is 10 m long and leans against a wall. If the base is 6 m from the wall, how high does the ladder reach?
If the average price of 4 items is $25, and three items cost $20, $30, and $15, what is the cost of the fourth item?
A store sells 500 items per week. If demand increases by 10% each week, how many items will be sold in week 2?
If a triangle has angles of 60°, 60°, and 60°, what type of triangle is it?
solution_text: It is an equilateral triangle (all angles equal and all sides equal)
